motherhaven_platform.description: Motherhaven is Mother Haven's Web3 platform and infrastructure - experimental platform for token creation, DEX trading, email, and news aggregation

token_factory.description: Create custom tokens with bonding curve mechanics

dex.description: Decentralized exchange for buying and selling tokens
dex.note: Maven (CFO) can potentially interact with DEX for trading operations

llm_bot_api.description: API for autonomous trading bot data ingestion and queries
llm_bot_api.note: Used by moha-bot (Maven's domain) to push trading data to motherhaven for visualization

news_aggregation.description: RSS feed aggregation and news delivery

roles: Email system user (read inbox, send emails)
Data provider (push moha-bot trading data via llm-bot API)
integration_points: Email API for communications with Boss and system notifications
DEX for potential token trading operations
LLM-bot API for pushing moha-bot performance data to dashboard

Grandfactory.description: Main factory for token creation with bonding curve
features: Token creation with optional initial purchase
State machine: NOT_CREATED → TRADING → GOAL_REACHED → RESUMED
Burn manager support for game mechanics
Two burn types: FACTORY (sells) and SELF (user burns)

moha_bot_infrastructure.description: Maven's primary domain - autonomous trading bot system
moha_bot_infrastructure.maven_role: Chief Financial Officer & Head of Finances

maven_persistence.note: Maven survives database wipes through git commits

moha_bot_to_motherhaven.purpose: Visualize moha-bot performance on motherhaven dashboard

maven_email.purpose: Maven communications with Boss (JB) and system notifications

authentication.email_api: Bearer token via EMAIL_API_SECRET environment variable

notes: Motherhaven is the Web3 frontend/platform for Mother Haven ecosystem
moha-bot is the backend trading system where Maven operates as CFO
Maven has email address maven@motherhaven.app for official communications
DEX on motherhaven could be used by Maven for token trading operations
All Maven persistence is git-first to survive database wipes
Boss (JB / ecoli) is the creator and administrator of both systems
